H0.text: Inherited from only one parent is the genetic trait pattern of the offspring that is formed when an egg and sperm unite to create an embryo.

H1.text: Created by the environment are the genetic traits of the offspring formed when an egg and sperm unite to form an embryo.

H2.text: Passed on from two parents is the genetic trait that the offspring will have when an egg and sperm form an embryo.

H3.text: Learned from siblings are the genetic traits that an offspring formed when an egg and sperm combine into an embryo will have.

A4.text: Organisms inherit genetic material from their parents in the form of homologous chromosomes, containing a unique combination of DNA sequences that code for genes.

A5.text: The complete set of observable traits of the structure and behavior of an organism is called its phenotype. These traits arise from the interaction of the organism's genotype with the environment.
